commit_message:
Add ignore_error_instances config option

This patch adds ignore_error_instances config option.
This option will allo operators to decide whether to rescue error
state instances or not.
When set to True, error state instances won't be rescued when host
failure heppen.

This config option was discussed at ML[1] and gerrit[2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-August/120985.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/469029/

Change-Id: Ic5aa3d54e8a8e7a750482593fcf2d7ac0114cd43

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-11 17:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_floating_ips.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/floating_ips.py'], 'message': "Handle conflict from neutron when addFloatingIP fails

Neutron can raise a Conflict exception when attempting
to associate a floating IP to a server when the fixed
address is already associated to another floating IP.
This has always resulted in a 400 response, however, it
would also trace an ERROR in the nova-api logs, which is
something we shouldn't be doing for an expected type of
failure.

This handles the Conflict in the neutronv2 API client code
and re-raises an exception that the REST API controller code
can handle and return as a 400 without the stacktrace in the
logs.

Change-Id: I27d3241300f75e2aa79a32348a3843e09123cb10
Closes-Bug: #1693576
(cherry picked from commit 452f21183f2f80cc5673ebd3fd3e5daf039caacc)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle conflict from neutron when addFloatingIP fails

Neutron can raise a Conflict exception when attempting
to associate a floating IP to a server when the fixed
address is already associated to another floating IP.
This has always resulted in a 400 response, however, it
would also trace an ERROR in the nova-api logs, which is
something we shouldn't be doing for an expected type of
failure.

This handles the Conflict in the neutronv2 API client code
and re-raises an exception that the REST API controller code
can handle and return as a 400 without the stacktrace in the
logs.

Change-Id: I27d3241300f75e2aa79a32348a3843e09123cb10
Closes-Bug: #1693576
(cherry picked from commit 452f21183f2f80cc5673ebd3fd3e5daf039caacc)

commit_message:
fullstack: Actually run ovsfw tests

super(...).setUp() must be called before OVSVersionChecker so that
rootwrap gets configured first.

Change-Id: Ie152f64a598a68566e36a4903017132e03eb35a6
Closes-bug: #1709547

subject: Fix python prereq install task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 14:49:53.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/openstack-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': "Fix python prereq install task

It's not possible to check ansible_pkg_mgr yet because we haven't
gathered facts. This patch adjusts the task to run on all distros
but it only has an effect on Ubuntu systems without python installed.

Change-Id: I8859b740a4d190fb1548af7ed7df92c248e2c5a3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix python prereq install task

It's not possible to check ansible_pkg_mgr yet because we haven't
gathered facts. This patch adjusts the task to run on all distros
but it only has an effect on Ubuntu systems without python installed.

Change-Id: I8859b740a4d190fb1548af7ed7df92c248e2c5a3

This patch improves the storage assisted retype functionality by
using the Unisphere "move" API where possible, instead of removing

commit_message:
VMAX driver - performance improvements in retype

This patch improves the storage assisted retype functionality by
using the Unisphere "move" API where possible, instead of removing
the volume from one storage group and then adding it to another.
This patch also corrects a minor mistake in how validity for
storage assisted retype is assessed, and explicitly blocks storage
assisted retype when a volume is attached.

Change-Id: I2270a78214457108d5baa02dac8a6cfd76e91239
Closes-Bug: #1704377

commit_message:
tasks: ceilometer_install: Fix virtualenv-tools issue on openSUSE

This is similar to I101fe7082cac887dc4299a0f5ec92bdce626bb79

openSUSE is also suffering from the same virtualenv-tools issue so
we need to remove the existing python-2.7 symlink.

Link: https://github.com/fireteam/virtualenv-tools/issues/5
Related-Bug: #1637509
Partial-Bug: #1644629
Change-Id: I780960418ff9da7cac2f8716e88d2d8fb7bdb1c6

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-24 19:31:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: Fix real use calculation

Current calculations for pool real usage are wrong, because we are
counting multiple times the same data objects.

The reason why we are counting multiple times the same data objects is
because we are not skipping the overlays with parent objects.

This patch modifies current call to `diff_iterate` so it will skip
parent's history diff.

Now if we only have cinder volumes in a pool we will be correctly
reporting the same value as the one reported by `rados df volumes`.

Closes-Bug: #1706143
Change-Id: I422be208dbaca22b06e2ef402151383354a75b52
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: Fix real use calculation

Current calculations for pool real usage are wrong, because we are
counting multiple times the same data objects.

The reason why we are counting multiple times the same data objects is
because we are not skipping the overlays with parent objects.

This patch modifies current call to `diff_iterate` so it will skip
parent's history diff.

Now if we only have cinder volumes in a pool we will be correctly
reporting the same value as the one reported by `rados df volumes`.

Closes-Bug: #1706143
Change-Id: I422be208dbaca22b06e2ef402151383354a75b52

commit_message:
Don't share swift client instances

THe swift backend was using swiftclient.Connection without any checks,
but that object is not thread safe, so we need to only have one
instance. This adds a wrapper to keep the same API but not share any
data.

Change-Id: Ic8152f8f7cb6d4d0b4ab473d2f937a9bc77b8453
(cherry picked from commit 80f8ca818aabea9b2f6a47d21ceba186185c111b)

commit_message:
Use AFS mirrors to download containers instead of docker.io

docker.io is not reliable and we now have AFS mirrors for all the
containers that we need in TripleO.
This patch aims to set docker_registry_host with the regional docker
registry mirror otherwise it fallbacks to docker.io.

Closes-Bug: #1710533
Change-Id: Ifd2ba651b38ae189e9306787b928958cf9500732

subject: Don't uninstall pip packages if OFFLINE=True
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26074, 'name': 'linxuhua', 'email': 'linxuhua@unionpay.com', 'username': 'linxuhua'}, {'_account_id': 26490, 'name': 'Jason SUN', 'email': 'sunjia@inspur.com', 'username': 'sunjia'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-14 06:08:39.000000000', 'files': ['inc/python'], 'message': "Don't uninstall pip packages if OFFLINE=True

lib/nova does a pip re-install of libvirt-python to rebuild the python
library incase the underlying libvirt version changed during package
installs.  In offline mode, the underlying version of libvirt can't
have changed; so we have the situation that we've removed the libvirt
python bindings but can't reinstall them (because we're offline).

This fixes that particular situation, but skipping uninstalls in
offline mode seems generically OK.

Change-Id: I2b75d45d94d82f87d996c7570c125d46f5f99f6a
Closes-Bug: #1708369
"}]
commit_message:
Don't uninstall pip packages if OFFLINE=True

lib/nova does a pip re-install of libvirt-python to rebuild the python
library incase the underlying libvirt version changed during package
installs.  In offline mode, the underlying version of libvirt can't
have changed; so we have the situation that we've removed the libvirt
python bindings but can't reinstall them (because we're offline).

This fixes that particular situation, but skipping uninstalls in
offline mode seems generically OK.

Change-Id: I2b75d45d94d82f87d996c7570c125d46f5f99f6a
Closes-Bug: #1708369

undercloud-container isn't deployed by tripleo-quickstart so it miss
some features needed to debug CI issues, like container log collection,
logstash queries, and the most important: using AFS mirrors.

Until we address all of that, let's disable, so we stabilize our CI.

Change-Id: I88657ad663b44f4d4e17d0c09e3392e3bc403352

commit_message:
tripleo: make undercloud-container non-voting

undercloud-container isn't deployed by tripleo-quickstart so it miss
some features needed to debug CI issues, like container log collection,
logstash queries, and the most important: using AFS mirrors.

Until we address all of that, let's disable, so we stabilize our CI.

Change-Id: I88657ad663b44f4d4e17d0c09e3392e3bc403352

subject: Mark stack failed when exception raised in resource check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-25 21:29:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/check_resource.py'], 'message': "Mark stack failed when exception raised in resource check

If we get an unexpected exception when checking a resource, try to clean
up by marking the stack as FAILED. The graph traversal will stop if we
can't propagate any more RPC messages, so without this the stack would
be stuck IN_PROGRESS indefinitely.

Change-Id: I56ecfa7a9a328d1435c1f34ab14e56effb81bb21
Closes-Bug: #1703043
"}]
commit_message:
Mark stack failed when exception raised in resource check

If we get an unexpected exception when checking a resource, try to clean
up by marking the stack as FAILED. The graph traversal will stop if we
can't propagate any more RPC messages, so without this the stack would
be stuck IN_PROGRESS indefinitely.

Change-Id: I56ecfa7a9a328d1435c1f34ab14e56effb81bb21
Closes-Bug: #1703043

subject: Fix swift messages posting when pooling
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-12 02:54:30.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/storage/swift/messages.py', 'zaqar/storage/swift/controllers.py', 'zaqar/storage/swift/driver.py', 'zaqar/tests/unit/storage/test_impl_swift.py', 'zaqar/storage/swift/queues.py'], 'message': 'Fix swift messages posting when pooling

1. Currently, swift driver is always getting the swift queue controller
which is not correct when pooling is enabled.

2. When using pooling, all the queues will be saved in management
database, it works for database backend. But it doesn' work for swift,
because for database backend, the queue name is just a field of the
message record. For swift, we're using container as the "queue" to
save messages. So before saving messages, we need to make sure the
container of the queue has been created.

Closes-Bug: 1680678

Change-Id: I5195911d22d5935aa3de105fe735ac159276a025
Depends-On: I972e3f43cbb370847a1c8b288546760092c14983
Depends-On: Ic8152f8f7cb6d4d0b4ab473d2f937a9bc77b8453
(cherry picked from commit e3444bb6b5adfe240bbb4fa3a14fbb11311c7139)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swift messages posting when pooling

1. Currently, swift driver is always getting the swift queue controller
which is not correct when pooling is enabled.

2. When using pooling, all the queues will be saved in management
database, it works for database backend. But it doesn' work for swift,
because for database backend, the queue name is just a field of the
message record. For swift, we're using container as the "queue" to
save messages. So before saving messages, we need to make sure the
container of the queue has been created.

Closes-Bug: 1680678

Change-Id: I5195911d22d5935aa3de105fe735ac159276a025
Depends-On: I972e3f43cbb370847a1c8b288546760092c14983
Depends-On: Ic8152f8f7cb6d4d0b4ab473d2f937a9bc77b8453
(cherry picked from commit e3444bb6b5adfe240bbb4fa3a14fbb11311c7139)

subject: Ignore conflict when deleting queues with Swift
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-14 07:26:11.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/storage/swift/messages.py'], 'message': "Ignore conflict when deleting queues with Swift

When we delete a queue with the Swift backend, we must first delete all
the objects from the container, and then the container itself.
Unfortunately, it's not transactional, so messages could have been put
in the mean time. As queues are lazy objects, I think it's fair to
ignore the conflict error in that case.

Change-Id: I8bcbb22265c401efa9a43c5db558beca4a0134a4
Depends-On: I3f797f4c4508b2818ac2a087e5c2d01821c7e5ec
(cherry picked from commit dee52a64a43f2566d060883bc248311d08c805c1)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore conflict when deleting queues with Swift

When we delete a queue with the Swift backend, we must first delete all
the objects from the container, and then the container itself.
Unfortunately, it's not transactional, so messages could have been put
in the mean time. As queues are lazy objects, I think it's fair to
ignore the conflict error in that case.

Change-Id: I8bcbb22265c401efa9a43c5db558beca4a0134a4
Depends-On: I3f797f4c4508b2818ac2a087e5c2d01821c7e5ec
(cherry picked from commit dee52a64a43f2566d060883bc248311d08c805c1)

commit_message:
Deprecate rpc_backend option

Option "rpc_backend" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated for removal
(Replaced by [DEFAULT]/transport_url). Its value may be silently
ignored in the future.

Change-Id: I85357a7ebae37c1e32f2f4558a195bff414a1341
Implements: blueprint deprecate-rpc-backend

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-11 14:18:35.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/debian-minimal/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'Add netbase to ensure /etc/protocols is placed for debian

Many programs rely upon /etc/protocols to be present

/etc/protocols. This is observable when building an image
for use with ironic via the ironic-agent element, since
the IPA agent fails to start as python needs /etc/protocols
to open a socket connection.

Added to debian-minimal as it is inherited into the debian
element.

Change-Id: Icc81635870961943707cf6b3f61a9ddbd51cb8fd
Closes-Bug: #1708531
'}]
commit_message:
Add netbase to ensure /etc/protocols is placed for debian

Many programs rely upon /etc/protocols to be present
however the default debian image that is generated lacks
/etc/protocols. This is observable when building an image
for use with ironic via the ironic-agent element, since
the IPA agent fails to start as python needs /etc/protocols
to open a socket connection.

Added to debian-minimal as it is inherited into the debian
element.

Change-Id: Icc81635870961943707cf6b3f61a9ddbd51cb8fd
Closes-Bug: #1708531

commit_message:
Remove the reload from the cinder playbook

This removes the reload from the cinder playbook because it's causing
the cinder service(s) to consume 100% CPU which causes gate issues, and
will result in misbehaving deployments in prod.

Closes-Bug: 1709346
Change-Id: Ifd3b7b7b177dfb7d6456f802284046dd7ce96a9a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

scripts. This function currently only works in a non-systemd world. Now

commit_message:
Remove ensure logs check in upgrade scripts

This commit removes the ensure_logs_exist call in all the upgrade
scripts. This function currently only works in a non-systemd world. Now
that all the logs go in the journal we can't check for separate log
files anymore. In the future we'll modifiy the function to handle
systemd and the journal properly, but for right now this is to unblock
things.

Change-Id: Iedf824a1772115e0dff287a898636f8e58471269

commit_message:
Include top-id in routing list

Currently only pod-id and resource type are showed in the routing list,
top-id should also be displayed.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Include top-id in routing list.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle client to
realize the solution
None.

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid usingg
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1]
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I19adc9253ce874205d12a5b5430818cbf94ed29c

commit_message:
[DNM] create intermediate LVMNode object, refactor slightly

The main insight here is that we create a "synchronisation" node that
drives the LVM setup and removal.  This removes all the "have I
already run" hacks and makes a single node that drives the LVM setup
and removal.  For the graph, see [1]

This also includes some refactoring to move the actually underlying
calls into the Node objects.  I believe this makes things a little
clearer, even if their create() and cleanup() calls are no-ops.

Some refactoring is done to remove intermediate variables and try to
simplify as much as possible.

Extra testing is added.

I plan to squash this, after it's had some eyes

[1] http://imgur.com/a/h1srW

Change-Id: I376f9c8063b9abe4223c03615d4a3c1e322b9ffd

subject: Only sleep following a role switch
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-08-14 02:34:59.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/unit/test_rbac_utils.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_utils.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/unit/fixtures.py'], 'message': 'Only sleep following a role switch

This commit drops support for not sleeping if the token being
used for keystone auth is UUID, as it is being deprecated
during the "R" release [0]. Thus, the condition for sleeping
has completely changed: Now, time.sleep(1) is only carried
out if the role actually switched (causing a token revocation
event in keystone and hence the need to sleep).

For example, if rbac_test_role = "admin" then there is no need
to sleep (except once, at the beginning, which strips the user
of any additional roles) as setup, API execution and clean up
all require admin. If rbac_test_role = "Member" then sleep
must be carried out each test at least twice, as setup requires
admin, API execution requires Member, and clean up requires
admin.

This commit also adds unit tests to confirm that sleep is
only performed if the role switched. This required
changes to some testing logic.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-August/121067.html

Change-Id: Iedc97397d9ae76c7f5efed5913850ced470c6c5f
Closes-Bug: #1710237
Depends-On: I34d324575c8117022724a944c034f089eb0c7541
'}]
commit_message:
Only sleep following a role switch

This commit drops support for not sleeping if the token being
used for keystone auth is UUID, as it is being deprecated
during the "R" release [0]. Thus, the condition for sleeping
has completely changed: Now, time.sleep(1) is only carried
out if the role actually switched (causing a token revocation
event in keystone and hence the need to sleep).

For example, if rbac_test_role = "admin" then there is no need
to sleep (except once, at the beginning, which strips the user
of any additional roles) as setup, API execution and clean up
all require admin. If rbac_test_role = "Member" then sleep
must be carried out each test at least twice, as setup requires
admin, API execution requires Member, and clean up requires
admin.

This commit also adds unit tests to confirm that sleep is
only performed if the role switched. This required
changes to some testing logic.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-August/121067.html

Change-Id: Iedc97397d9ae76c7f5efed5913850ced470c6c5f
Closes-Bug: #1710237
Depends-On: I34d324575c8117022724a944c034f089eb0c7541

commit_message:
Enable TLS configuration for containerized Galera

In non-containerized deployments, Galera can be configured to use TLS
for gcomm group communication when enable_internal_tls is set to true.

Fix the metadata service definition and update the Kolla configuration
to make gcomm use TLS in containers, if configured.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: Ibead27be81910f946d64b8e5421bcc41210d7430
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1708135
Depends-On: If845baa7b0a437c28148c817b7f94d540ca15814

subject: Make HA container bundle work on remote nodes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-08-08 20:50:38.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/pacemaker_remote.yaml'], 'message': "Make HA container bundle work on remote nodes

Right now when we deploy an HA bundle on a pacemaker remote node,
the deploy will fail due to the fact that the bundle includes
tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker which makes a call to
hiera('hacluster_pwd') which will fail on pcmk remote nodes.
While we could noop the profile on pcmk nodes, it's much simpler
to just make sure this hiera key exists on pcmk remote nodes.

Also make sure that pacemaker::corosync::manage_fw is set to false
on remote nodes, otherwise the mere inclusion of the pacemaker
profile will cause iptables-save to run in a container and thus failing.

Change-Id: I09b3e54a470cc2d600a701d23463962501c5c9d6
"}]
commit_message:
Make HA container bundle work on remote nodes

Right now when we deploy an HA bundle on a pacemaker remote node,
the deploy will fail due to the fact that the bundle includes
tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker which makes a call to
hiera('hacluster_pwd') which will fail on pcmk remote nodes.
While we could noop the profile on pcmk nodes, it's much simpler
to just make sure this hiera key exists on pcmk remote nodes.

Also make sure that pacemaker::corosync::manage_fw is set to false
on remote nodes, otherwise the mere inclusion of the pacemaker
profile will cause iptables-save to run in a container and thus failing.

Change-Id: I09b3e54a470cc2d600a701d23463962501c5c9d6

subject: Fix legacy nova/cinder encryption key manager configuration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-30 19:19:18.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/nova/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_cinder_api_spec.rb', 'spec/fixtures/hieradata/step4.yaml', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_nova_compute_spec.rb', 'manifests/profile/base/cinder/api.pp'], 'message': 'Fix legacy nova/cinder encryption key manager configuration

Recent changes in Nova [0] and Cinder [1] result in Barbican being selected
as the default encryption key manager, even when TripleO is not deploying
Barbican.

This change ensures the legacy key manager is enabled when no key manager
(such as Barbican) has been specified. This restores the previous behavior,
where the legacy key manager was enabled by default.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/484501
[1] https://review.openstack.org/485322

Closes-Bug: #1706389
Change-Id: Idc92f7a77cde757538eaac51c4ad8dc397f9c3d3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix legacy nova/cinder encryption key manager configuration

Recent changes in Nova [0] and Cinder [1] result in Barbican being selected
as the default encryption key manager, even when TripleO is not deploying
Barbican.

This change ensures the legacy key manager is enabled when no key manager
(such as Barbican) has been specified. This restores the previous behavior,
where the legacy key manager was enabled by default.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/484501
[1] https://review.openstack.org/485322

Closes-Bug: #1706389
Change-Id: Idc92f7a77cde757538eaac51c4ad8dc397f9c3d3

subject: Fix metadata_settings in containerized mongodb
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-14 11:39:02.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/database/mongodb.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix metadata_settings in containerized mongodb

The containerized version of the mongodb service omits the
metadata_settings definition [1], which confuses certmonger when
internal TLS is enabled and make the generation of certificates fail.

Use the right setting from the non-containerized profile.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/461780/

Change-Id: I50a9a3a822ba5ef5d2657a12c359b51b7a3a42f2
Closes-Bug: #1709553
'}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata_settings in containerized mongodb

The containerized version of the mongodb service omits the
metadata_settings definition [1], which confuses certmonger when
internal TLS is enabled and make the generation of certificates fail.

Use the right setting from the non-containerized profile.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/461780/

Change-Id: I50a9a3a822ba5ef5d2657a12c359b51b7a3a42f2
Closes-Bug: #1709553

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-09 06:42:38.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/App.js', 'src/js/components/UserAuthenticator.js', 'src/js/components/notifications/Notification.js', 'src/js/components/notifications/NotificationsToaster.js', 'src/less/utils/patternflyOverrides.less', 'src/js/selectors/notifications.js', 'src/js/immutableRecords/notifications.js', 'src/js/components/login/Login.js'], 'message': "Notifications fixes

* move NotificationsToaster into App.js to use it only ince in the app
* remove visual properties (dismissable, timeoutable) from notification record
* don't auto hide 'error' type notifications, so they don't vanish before
  user reads them
* render NotificationsToaster above modals
* use up to date patternfly class for NotificationsToaster so the messages
  don't disappear when view is scrolled (position fixed vs absolute)

Closes-Bug: 1674361

Change-Id: I9fce702fd104aa31daf5991e6683fde586b3f0cb
"}]
commit_message:
Notifications fixes

* move NotificationsToaster into App.js to use it only ince in the app
* remove visual properties (dismissable, timeoutable) from notification record
* don't auto hide 'error' type notifications, so they don't vanish before
  user reads them
* render NotificationsToaster above modals
* use up to date patternfly class for NotificationsToaster so the messages
  don't disappear when view is scrolled (position fixed vs absolute)

Closes-Bug: 1674361
Closes-Bug: 1647705
Change-Id: I9fce702fd104aa31daf5991e6683fde586b3f0cb

containerized TLS work, it is needed in the container version as well.

the remove-machine-id element to make sure it is cleaned from the
overcloud image during the build process.

commit_message:
Remove machine-id from image

We should not be providing a machine-id in the overcloud images, so use
the remove-machine-id element to make sure it is cleaned from the
overcloud image during the build process.

Change-Id: I1d4f86ca9f173195ac4477be43b62a0ce388cc79
Depends-On: Idd848cd307c179afa557618f44db34b2fb57d937
Closes-Bug: #1672461

commit_message:
Cleanup the last warning on doc building (html and man)

- Quote the hyphens so that they are shown unchanged
Closes-Bug: #1710628

- Restructure the Feature-by-Plugin table, simplifying
  it a bit so that the generation of man pages does not
  issue a warning (and so that the looks on the HTML
  version is still acceptable). It looks like the
  man page generator is more limited.
Closes-Bug: #1710608

- Add the missing help entry to a configuration key,
  removing a warning
Closes-Bug: #1710673

Change-Id: I010b4a9114e6b21068b6d48243ac0a292a3bb497

Fix error during node group template update

this is because an optional key is referenced in calling validation
function which results in KeyError when key doesn't exist, and it
does not ever actually get used.

(cherry picked from commit a76a9011df7cb8385315255dc98da5322e7a2bc1)

this is because an optional key is referenced in calling validation
function which results in KeyError when key doesn't exist, and it
does not ever actually get used.

Closes-Bug: #1672516
(cherry picked from commit a76a9011df7cb8385315255dc98da5322e7a2bc1)

commit_message:
Prevent regression of IP loss on MAC update

This adjusts the UTs to ensure MAC address updates
don't wipe out the original fixed IPs on a port if the
IPs weren't part of the update.

Change-Id: Ibd9ec8ece6678c837027b59c1154db872270e7be
Related-Bug: #1684038

subject: Publish placement-api-ref
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-08 17:00:38.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/api-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Publish placement-api-ref

Make a special placement-api-ref publishing job for the
placement API. A special job is required because placement is hosted
within the nova repository, in its own sub-directory. The api-ref template
job is not set up for that.

We could probably have done some refactoring to reuse the existing
template but since it is planned for placement to eventually move out of
the nova repo, it's not really worth it.

This change also makes the gate-placement-api-ref job voting, the change
linked via depends-on below provides testing to ensure that all
placement URLs and methods have documentation.

In I895333c21a18afadaf987f8f9903a0c8b132b1d5 there was discussion that
this style of publishing job was incorrect and api-ref should be moved
under doc/source. This is not desirable for API reference because we do
not wish for API references to be versioned in the same way that project
documentation is versioned. Also, placement's odd positioning within
a repo with another service makes that complex. This change continues
the desirable publishing to developer.openstack.org and maintains the
patterns and standards set by nova's api-ref.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Volkov <avolkov@mirantis.com>
Depends-On: Ifefedcd51f1f8d5e741ef6d02b7a0879a185e05f
Change-Id: If5ff9bcc31e2680861e959ef7dc8581210e619e9
"}]
commit_message:
Publish placement-api-ref

Make a special placement-api-ref publishing job for the
placement API. A special job is required because placement is hosted
within the nova repository, in its own sub-directory. The api-ref template
job is not set up for that.

We could probably have done some refactoring to reuse the existing
template but since it is planned for placement to eventually move out of
the nova repo, it's not really worth it.

This change also makes the gate-placement-api-ref job voting, the change
linked via depends-on below provides testing to ensure that all
placement URLs and methods have documentation.

In I895333c21a18afadaf987f8f9903a0c8b132b1d5 there was discussion that
this style of publishing job was incorrect and api-ref should be moved
under doc/source. This is not desirable for API reference because we do
not wish for API references to be versioned in the same way that project
documentation is versioned. Also, placement's odd positioning within
a repo with another service makes that complex. This change continues
the desirable publishing to developer.openstack.org and maintains the
patterns and standards set by nova's api-ref.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Volkov <avolkov@mirantis.com>
Depends-On: Ifefedcd51f1f8d5e741ef6d02b7a0879a185e05f
Change-Id: If5ff9bcc31e2680861e959ef7dc8581210e619e9

commit_message:
Warn our users about Nova API in WSGI with Apache

It was suggested by Nova team to not deploying Nova API in WSGI with
Apache in production.
It's causing some issues that we didn't catch until now (see in the bug
report).

Change-Id: I163c85337437704ec3668fc9fa5e2c40eb23248c
Related-Bug: 1661360

subject: Non-unique project names: by_project as list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 22:50:54.000000000', 'files': ['os_service_types/service_types.py', 'os_service_types/tests/base.py'], 'message': "Non-unique project names: by_project as list

This is basically to support the 'placement' service while it's still
part of the nova project.

Previously ServiceTypes.get_service_data_for_project returned the
(unique) service data entry for a given project.  Now it returns a list
thereof.  This will almost always have one entry; the exception will be
get_service_data_for_project('nova'), which will return service data for
both nova and placement.

Change-Id: Ib4b85950cbfddcd8433f2eb36f197d6e3bc010b2
"}]
commit_message:
Non-unique project names: by_project as list

This is basically to support the 'placement' service while it's still
part of the nova project.

Previously ServiceTypes.get_service_data_for_project returned the
(unique) service data entry for a given project.  Now it returns a list
thereof.  This will almost always have one entry; the exception will be
get_service_data_for_project('nova'), which will return service data for
both nova and placement.

Change-Id: Ib4b85950cbfddcd8433f2eb36f197d6e3bc010b2

commit_message:
Check for volumev2 and volumev3 too

If we don't check for all three possible Cinder service types, we may
end up with Cinder options hidden even when the service is in fact
available.

Change-Id: Ic844dc7d3b138b0918f9c436f0550fe0a4379bae
Closes-Bug: #1678534
(cherry picked from commit ed4cb76aa2e5b00f1671d9dbcbc5a8dda589365a)

commit_message:
[Api-ref] remove "is_public" in snapshot updated description

In api-ref/source/snapshot.inc, when update a snapshot, we can only update
its "display_name" and "display_description", is_public can not be updated,
So this change is to remove "is_public" in update snapshot description.

Change-Id: I02109fc032df4bbf8ef487a567c7dd8d1d9c66ce
Closes-bug: #1710523

subject: Bring back local search
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-12 14:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/search.html', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/css/combined.css', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/layout.html', 'releasenotes/notes/local-project-search-e6f00a84f2eed0a6.yaml', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/script_footer.html'], 'message': "Bring back local search

This makes the search.html page that's generated by sphinx function as
the local search, and not the global google based swift_search. The
sphinx integrated search will mean that only documents linked to the
current tree will be returned, which also ensures that searching for
content in stable/pike doesn't jump you to mitaka answers. It also
brings back highlighting of search results which is a style rule that
was lost in the building of the openstackdocstheme.

We probably also want sidebar integration of this search field,
however this will at least mean hitting the search.html page will do
what people previously expected.

Change-Id: I747ad28658e12441ccad7081d15788f5d738dc5e
"}]
commit_message:
Bring back local search

This makes the search.html page that's generated by sphinx function as
the local search, and not the global google based swift_search. The
sphinx integrated search will mean that only documents linked to the
current tree will be returned, which also ensures that searching for
content in stable/pike doesn't jump you to mitaka answers. It also
brings back highlighting of search results which is a style rule that
was lost in the building of the openstackdocstheme.

We probably also want sidebar integration of this search field,
however this will at least mean hitting the search.html page will do
what people previously expected.

Change-Id: I747ad28658e12441ccad7081d15788f5d738dc5e

commit_message:
Make code follow log translation guideline

Since Pike log messages should not be translated.
This patch removes calls to i18n _LC, _LI, _LE, _LW from
logging logic throughout the code. Translators definition
from neutron._i18n is removed as well.
This patch also removes log translation verification from
ignore directive in tox.ini.

Change-Id: If9aa76fcf121c0e61a7c08088006c5873faee56e

commit_message:
Introduce common setting for grenade and devstack plugins

This will help us to get rid of sourcing old stackrc during the
upgrade, which for example causes the old networking-generic-switch
upgrade script to be run instead the new one.

Change-Id: I53f37792c2968ec96358e357696260e406cf02d3

commit_message:
Revert "Temporarily stop using citycloud-sto2"

Bring sto2 back online and monitor.

* added ip alias for interfaces

* Update settings and improve vm performance

* Change the VG name in VMs. The VG name was changed so that the volume
  which is being used by VMs can be mounted on a physical host, and not
  conflict, with standard volume group naming. This is usful when a VM
  is DOA and a deployer wants to disect the instance.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
General improvements

* added ip alias for interfaces

* Update settings and improve vm performance

* Change the VG name in VMs. The VG name was changed so that the volume
  which is being used by VMs can be mounted on a physical host, and not
  conflict, with standard volume group naming. This is usful when a VM
  is DOA and a deployer wants to disect the instance.

Change-Id: If4d10165fe08f82400772ca88f8490b01bad5cf8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Check for volumev2 and volumev3 too

If we don't check for all three possible Cinder service types, we may
end up with Cinder options hidden even when the service is in fact
available.

Change-Id: Ic844dc7d3b138b0918f9c436f0550fe0a4379bae
Closes-Bug: #1678534
(cherry picked from commit ed4cb76aa2e5b00f1671d9dbcbc5a8dda589365a)

commit_message:
Just to migrate existing resource to backup stack

Don't create a resource record for backup stack if the
resource record exists, just to migrate it to backup
stack, to avoid redundant data remaining for existing
stack.

This patch also adds resource.store() which covers
_store() and _store_or_update() implemention. And then
we can delete the two methods.

Closes-Bug: #1662095
(cherry picked from commit b2e436aa67b373c4424cce7813ed1a0b0e54a734)

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resource.py
	heat/tests/test_engine_api_utils.py
	heat/tests/test_event.py
	heat/tests/test_resource.py

Change-Id: I0b4b983306ea84fab0e2c81876ef407a80d25989

subject: Cleanup HAProxy before re-deploying haproxy
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-11 15:00:46.000000000', 'files': ['leap-upgrades/re-deploy.sh', 'leap-upgrades/upgrade-utilities/haproxy-cleanup.yml', 'leap-upgrades/upgrade-utilities/haproxy-cleanup.init'], 'message': 'Cleanup HAProxy before re-deploying haproxy

HAProxy should not have an init that loads conf.d files, like it
was done on K, and removed in N, during the haproxy installation.
Else the installation of the package will fail, because it will
load the conf.d files.

Change-Id: I345089cc3493b90c1c4fbd2d47c51f83c65c94f4
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup HAProxy before re-deploying haproxy

HAProxy should not have an init that loads conf.d files, like it
was done on K, and removed in N, during the haproxy installation.
Else the installation of the package will fail, because it will
load the conf.d files.

Change-Id: I345089cc3493b90c1c4fbd2d47c51f83c65c94f4

subject: Implement create with specified neutron net
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-09 15:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['zun/network/neutron.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py'], 'message': "Implement create with specified neutron net

Support creating container with specified neutron net. Users
can pass the uuid/name of an existing neutron network via the 'nets'
parameter. If network is specified, Zun will use the specified network
instead of searching one.

NOTE: If both 'port' and 'network' is set via the 'nets' parameter,
the 'network' will be ignored since Zun will use the network of the
existing port.

Change-Id: I8a0f4f7461a99c1c3bafdfd2baa5b51800292230
Partial-Implements: blueprint multiple-networks
Closes-Bug: #1705154
"}]
commit_message:
Implement create with specified neutron net

Support creating container with specified neutron net. Users
can pass the uuid/name of an existing neutron network via the 'nets'
parameter. If network is specified, Zun will use the specified network
instead of searching one.

NOTE: If both 'port' and 'network' is set via the 'nets' parameter,
the 'network' will be ignored since Zun will use the network of the
existing port.

Change-Id: I8a0f4f7461a99c1c3bafdfd2baa5b51800292230
Partial-Implements: blueprint multiple-networks
Closes-Bug: #1705154

commit_message:
Replace e.message with str(e)

The 'message' attribute has been deprecated. A prefered way is to
call str(e), and this patch will replace e.message with str(e).
For more information, please see:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: I96cbd859b172291564188a0a9fbc5372d2bf4bae

Fix error during node group template update

this is because an optional key is referenced in calling validation
function which results in KeyError when key doesn't exist, and it
does not ever actually get used.

subject: Reuse neutron-lib for pep8 hacking checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-17 07:52:55.000000000', 'files': ['fuxi/controllers.py', 'fuxi/connector/osbrickconnector.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Reuse neutron-lib for pep8 hacking checks

neutron library has a good hacking rules set, we can use these rules
instead of reinvent the wheel. These such rules are:

- [N521] Validate that jsonutils module is used instead of json
- [N532] Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of LOG.warn. The
         latter is deprecated.
- [N537] Don't translate logs.
- [N534] Exception messages should be translated

It also enables H904, which allows the logging package to skip
creating the formatted log message if the message is not going
to be emitted because of the current log level.

Change-Id: I3b3649bbe8a7a3ae69d3ea1553923567b5a350d7
Closes-Bug: #1704691
"}]
commit_message:
Reuse neutron-lib for pep8 hacking checks

neutron library has a good hacking rules set, we can use these rules
instead of reinvent the wheel. These such rules are:

- [N521] Validate that jsonutils module is used instead of json
- [N532] Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of LOG.warn. The
         latter is deprecated.
- [N537] Don't translate logs.
- [N534] Exception messages should be translated

It also enables H904, which allows the logging package to skip
creating the formatted log message if the message is not going
to be emitted because of the current log level.

Change-Id: I3b3649bbe8a7a3ae69d3ea1553923567b5a350d7
Closes-Bug: #1704691

commit_message:
Check for volumev2 and volumev3 too

If we don't check for all three possible Cinder service types, we may
end up with Cinder options hidden even when the service is in fact
available.

Change-Id: Ic844dc7d3b138b0918f9c436f0550fe0a4379bae
Closes-Bug: #1678534

subject: Fix SMB volume detachment issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-14 12:50:03.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/volumeops.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': "Fix SMB volume detachment issue

A recent change introduced a regression which prevents SMB volumes
from being detached. By passing the volume tag to os-win when
detaching a disk, os-win then ignores the disk path and attempts
to retrieve the attachment using the tag.

Virtual images don't get tagged, for which reason detaches will fail
siliently.

For now, we'll just skip passing the tag when detaching such disks.

Change-Id: Ie0500c29bfbbd63761b732872f1dda92720dbe21
Closes-Bug: #1710616
"}]
commit_message:
Fix SMB volume detachment issue

A recent change introduced a regression which prevents SMB volumes
from being detached. By passing the volume tag to os-win when
detaching a disk, os-win then ignores the disk path and attempts
to retrieve the attachment using the tag.

Virtual images don't get tagged, for which reason detaches will fail
siliently.

For now, we'll just skip passing the tag when detaching such disks.

Change-Id: Ie0500c29bfbbd63761b732872f1dda92720dbe21
Closes-Bug: #1710616

commit_message:
Allow external restart handler orchestration

Allow the playbook to define its own restart handlers in lieu of the
restart tasks included with the role. This is ideal when upstream
load balancer orchestration should occur around service restarts.

Change-Id: Ia0a37527a73c940d4f164e147ce66c40a670c370

subject: Allow discovery URLs to have trailing slashes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-14 08:28:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/discover.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/identity/test_identity_common.py'], 'message': "Allow discovery URLs to have trailing slashes

The _get_discovery_url_choices generator works by taking a starting URL,
splitting it on '/', and working through the parts trying to get a
matching discovery document from it. It makes assumptions about what the
URL might look like: it might have a project ID on the end of it, and a
version before that. If the starting URL has a trailing '/', splitting
the URL results in an empty string at the end of the list of parts,
which is then treated as a version. The real version is left on the URL
while the generator assumes it has already trimmed the URL down to an
unversioned endpoint. If that version does not match the version we're
seeking, the resulting discovery document will be mismatched and the
generator will fail to yield the right endpoint.

This patch normalizes the starting URL by removing the trailing '/', if
there is one. This way every part of the split URL will be meaningful.

Closes-bug: #1709658

Change-Id: I28c48f78d6f07804d6ea228f163dd37b0fcfcd58
"}]
commit_message:
Allow discovery URLs to have trailing slashes

The _get_discovery_url_choices generator works by taking a starting URL,
splitting it on '/', and working through the parts trying to get a
matching discovery document from it. It makes assumptions about what the
URL might look like: it might have a project ID on the end of it, and a
version before that. If the starting URL has a trailing '/', splitting
the URL results in an empty string at the end of the list of parts,
which is then treated as a version. The real version is left on the URL
while the generator assumes it has already trimmed the URL down to an
unversioned endpoint. If that version does not match the version we're
seeking, the resulting discovery document will be mismatched and the
generator will fail to yield the right endpoint.

This patch normalizes the starting URL by removing the trailing '/', if
there is one. This way every part of the split URL will be meaningful.

Closes-bug: #1709658

Change-Id: I28c48f78d6f07804d6ea228f163dd37b0fcfcd58

subject: Remove 'persisted dirty' log message
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-10 07:54:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/quota/resource.py'], 'message': "Remove 'persisted dirty' log message

In a gate run the neutron.quota.resource module logged 5235
lines from this module, making it one of the top offenders.
This single line accounted for 3297 of those entries and it
offers limited information since the quota engine is quite
stable at this point and debugging tenants' dirty status isn't
an issue that comes up.

We can just get rid of this particular log line.

Change-Id: I9cb0fcfbad51a0863d04fb89fbb8b09e3e21bdf0
Partial-Bug: #1707307
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'persisted dirty' log message

In a gate run the neutron.quota.resource module logged 5235
lines from this module, making it one of the top offenders.
This single line accounted for 3297 of those entries and it
offers limited information since the quota engine is quite
stable at this point and debugging tenants' dirty status isn't
an issue that comes up.

We can just get rid of this particular log line.

Change-Id: I9cb0fcfbad51a0863d04fb89fbb8b09e3e21bdf0
Partial-Bug: #1707307

subject: Use zaqar v2 in integration tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 04:31:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_event_sinks.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_waitcondition.py'], 'message': "Use zaqar v2 in integration tests

zaqar v1/1.1 has been deprecated since long. Though it's enabled
in the devstack plugin[1], this may cause some issues and potential
data loss. Better remove all it's usage.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/zaqar/tree/devstack/plugin.sh#n88

Change-Id: Ifa1636dcf296747735dc8d28c2feb108919c094d
"}]
commit_message:
Use zaqar v2 in integration tests

zaqar v1/1.1 has been deprecated since long. Though it's enabled
in the devstack plugin[1], this may cause some issues and potential
data loss. Better remove all it's usage.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/zaqar/tree/devstack/plugin.sh#n88

Change-Id: Ifa1636dcf296747735dc8d28c2feb108919c094d

subject: Avoid creating two Stacks when loading Resource
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-07-22 01:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/aws/cfn/wait_condition.py', 'heat/engine/worker.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Avoid creating two Stacks when loading Resource

When load()ing a Resource in order to check it, we must load its definition
from whatever version of the template it was created or last updated with.
Previously we created a second Stack object with that template in order to
obtain the resource definition. Since all we really need in order to obtain
this is the StackDefinition, create just that instead.

Change-Id: Ia05983c3d1b838d2e28bb5eca38d13e83ccaf368
Implements: blueprint stack-definition
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid creating two Stacks when loading Resource

When load()ing a Resource in order to check it, we must load its definition
from whatever version of the template it was created or last updated with.
Previously we created a second Stack object with that template in order to
obtain the resource definition. Since all we really need in order to obtain
this is the StackDefinition, create just that instead.

Change-Id: Ia05983c3d1b838d2e28bb5eca38d13e83ccaf368
Implements: blueprint stack-definition

subject: Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 16:07:10.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options

When the template options are applied, a newline is added
to the end of lxc_cache_download_template_options before
the application of the keyserver option, causing this:

"... --variant default \n --keyserver ..."

While this works, it could cause unexpected behaviour
(perhaps not applying the keyserver option) and it is
therefore better to be rid of the newline.

Change-Id: I8099d6b0502c281572f9e45573a4d6bbb8c90c44
(cherry picked from commit e88e41c4af14ed34f114cc5693960ee5bd8f88f2)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options

When the template options are applied, a newline is added
to the end of lxc_cache_download_template_options before
the application of the keyserver option, causing this:

"... --variant default \n --keyserver ..."

While this works, it could cause unexpected behaviour
(perhaps not applying the keyserver option) and it is
therefore better to be rid of the newline.

Change-Id: I8099d6b0502c281572f9e45573a4d6bbb8c90c44
(cherry picked from commit e88e41c4af14ed34f114cc5693960ee5bd8f88f2)

This change adds a OS::TripleO::Tasks::AllNodesDeployStepsPre resource,
disabled by default, which can be used to create arbitrary nested
stacks after the nodes and the networks are validated but before
deploying the steps on the nodes.

The service_ips struct from all roles is provided to the nested stack
as parameter.

Change-Id: I3399a9ade3d73f862c31e2426409a681e068f312
'}]
commit_message:
Add a generic interface to create nested stacks before the steps

This change adds a OS::TripleO::Tasks::AllNodesDeployStepsPre resource,
disabled by default, which can be used to create arbitrary nested
stacks after the nodes and the networks are validated but before
deploying the steps on the nodes.

The service_ips struct from all roles is provided to the nested stack
as parameter.

Change-Id: I3399a9ade3d73f862c31e2426409a681e068f312

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-29 17:54:35.000000000', 'files': ['docker/docker-steps.j2', 'puppet/puppet-steps.j2'], 'message': 'Remove conditions on _Execution resources

Conditioned resources seems to break on upgrade with:
  "WorkflowTasks_Step1_Execution" is incorrect

commit_message:
Remove conditions on _Execution resources

Conditioned resources seems to break on upgrade with:
  "WorkflowTasks_Step1_Execution" is incorrect

This change always creates the _Execution resources, making them
run at least a single echo action.

Change-Id: I03e2543da70449e8187f3df12e4fc00447c3c6ec

commit_message:
Fix the domain name in admin-openrc.sh.j2

Because the default domain name is "Default" in
ansible/group_vars/all.yml (default domain id is "default"),
the domain name in admin-openrc also should be "Default".

Change-Id: I05f905d87ca57c09d4bdf540c4efbe06ee9bff67
Signed-off-by: Alex Yang <yangyang1@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Configurable ansible_ssh_user for tripleo-ansible-inventory

The ansible_ssh_user in the generated inventory by
tripleo-ansible-inventory is now configurable instead
of hardcoded to heat-admin. The default is still heat-admin.

subject: Fix the 'addresses' field of container
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-10 14:08:11.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/samples/container-update-resp.json', 'zun/network/kuryr_network.py', 'api-ref/source/samples/container-show-resp.json', 'zun/container/docker/driver.py', 'api-ref/source/samples/container-rename-resp.json', 'api-ref/source/samples/container-get-all-resp.json'], 'message': "Fix the 'addresses' field of container

The 'addresses' field is a map of ip addresses. In before, it
used docker network name as key, which is hard to be interpreted
by users, since docker network is hiden from end-users. This commit
switches to use neutron network uuid as key. A use case is from our
Heat plugin, which requires neutron network information to do
orchestration.

Change-Id: Ic3e4ee80962cdd777543e5c9c988fc0cdc623dad
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the 'addresses' field of container

The 'addresses' field is a map of ip addresses. In before, it
used docker network name as key, which is hard to be interpreted
by users, since docker network is hiden from end-users. This commit
switches to use neutron network uuid as key. A use case is from our
Heat plugin, which requires neutron network information to do
orchestration.

Change-Id: Ic3e4ee80962cdd777543e5c9c988fc0cdc623dad

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7249, 'name': 'Ann Taraday', 'email': 'akamyshnikova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AKamyshnikova'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12444, 'name': 'John Schwarz', 'email': 'jschwarz@redhat.com', 'username': 'jschwarz'}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-01 09:58:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py'], 'message': "Functional tests: change assert to wait_until_true

In certain cases, the keepalived can take a few seconds to run/stop.
For this reason, the patch proposes a change to the tests, in which
instead of asserting that the process started/stopped, we'll wait a
short while until they do. This will cause failing tests to not fail
simply because it took a few extra CPU cycles to run.

Change-Id: I497ef32651fbb68bf49e172543f9675f6279df4b
"}]
commit_message:
Functional tests: change assert to wait_until_true

In certain cases, the keepalived can take a few seconds to run/stop.
For this reason, the patch proposes a change to the tests, in which
instead of asserting that the process started/stopped, we'll wait a
short while until they do. This will cause failing tests to not fail
simply because it took a few extra CPU cycles to run.

Change-Id: I497ef32651fbb68bf49e172543f9675f6279df4b

as a requirement, when producing images with partitions.

subject: Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-11 16:17:34.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options

When the template options are applied, a newline is added
to the end of lxc_cache_download_template_options before
the application of the keyserver option, causing this:

"... --variant default \n --keyserver ..."

While this works, it could cause unexpected behaviour
(perhaps not applying the keyserver option) and it is
therefore better to be rid of the newline.

Change-Id: I8099d6b0502c281572f9e45573a4d6bbb8c90c44
(cherry picked from commit e88e41c4af14ed34f114cc5693960ee5bd8f88f2)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options

When the template options are applied, a newline is added
to the end of lxc_cache_download_template_options before
the application of the keyserver option, causing this:

"... --variant default \n --keyserver ..."

While this works, it could cause unexpected behaviour
(perhaps not applying the keyserver option) and it is
therefore better to be rid of the newline.

Change-Id: I8099d6b0502c281572f9e45573a4d6bbb8c90c44
(cherry picked from commit e88e41c4af14ed34f114cc5693960ee5bd8f88f2)

commit_message:
refarch: Update documentation and diagrams

Include details about the new networking-ovn-metadata-agent
support that runs on the compute node, and the details about
Gateway Chassis nodes.

Still work needs to be done to explain L3HA support in the future,
and to explain how DHCP and DNS work now.

Change-Id: I1865828e85931e5f1aa4f1e9487a0de39a157932

commit_message:
Add devstack plugin to install networking_baremetal

To enable networking-baremetal in devstack installation
add the following to local.conf

enable_plugin networking-baremetal git://git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-baremetal.git

Change-Id: I605853a1decee6292ed9469be2f35b572049d919

commit_message:
Add guide for Tricircle CLI

1. What is the problem?
Currently no doc about how to use Tricircle CLI.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Add the simplest guide for Tricircle CLI, and check to see
whether the stable/pike branch can pass all tests or not.

the solution?
None

commit_message:

of resources whose type is being protected. This introduced a bug where

subject: Deprecate oslo.messaging rpc_backend option parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-07 04:03:24.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/cloudkitty_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Deprecate oslo.messaging rpc_backend option parameter

Oslo.messaging uses the transport_url to represent the rpc and
notification messaging driver to use and its full configuration. The
rpc_backend configuration option is deprecated for removal and
should not gate oslo.messaging driver configuration options.

This patch:
* deprecate rpc_backend
* remove conditional check
* update spec tests

Change-Id: I3b494fe388b542d9d7c993c6438b6017e0d7b933
Closes-Bug: #1708976
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate oslo.messaging rpc_backend option parameter

Oslo.messaging uses the transport_url to represent the rpc and
notification messaging driver to use and its full configuration. The
rpc_backend configuration option is deprecated for removal and
should not gate oslo.messaging driver configuration options.

This patch:
* deprecate rpc_backend
* remove conditional check
* update spec tests

Change-Id: I3b494fe388b542d9d7c993c6438b6017e0d7b933
Closes-Bug: #1708976

subject: Add dnf support / Use transactions
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-08-11 14:31:51.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml'], 'message': 'Add dnf support / Use transactions

This patch adds dnf support to the cache prep process.

In addition, this patch changes the yum/dnf cache prep operations
into a single transaction. This is more efficient since it allows
the package manager to solve all of the dependencies in one go and
the package installation happens in one pass (rather than two).

Implements: blueprint centos-and-dnf
Change-Id: I60b6369bf96dfc76918a0cc85f2bb278e2ed2f39
'}]
commit_message:
Add dnf support / Use transactions

This patch adds dnf support to the cache prep process.

In addition, this patch changes the yum/dnf cache prep operations
into a single transaction. This is more efficient since it allows
the package manager to solve all of the dependencies in one go and
the package installation happens in one pass (rather than two).

Implements: blueprint centos-and-dnf
Change-Id: I60b6369bf96dfc76918a0cc85f2bb278e2ed2f39

subject: Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 16:57:10.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options

When the template options are applied, a newline is added
to the end of lxc_cache_download_template_options before
the application of the keyserver option, causing this:

"... --variant default \n --keyserver ..."

While this works, it could cause unexpected behaviour
(perhaps not applying the keyserver option) and it is
therefore better to be rid of the newline.

Change-Id: I2c194b5785618a6cc2785fe0c23cd8a7b8532904
(cherry picked from commit 2bd1b6a1d02a4f3b6df66f72808a72fbfeb786bd)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove newline from lxc_cache_download_template_options

When the template options are applied, a newline is added
to the end of lxc_cache_download_template_options before
the application of the keyserver option, causing this:

"... --variant default \n --keyserver ..."

While this works, it could cause unexpected behaviour
(perhaps not applying the keyserver option) and it is
therefore better to be rid of the newline.

Change-Id: I2c194b5785618a6cc2785fe0c23cd8a7b8532904
(cherry picked from commit 2bd1b6a1d02a4f3b6df66f72808a72fbfeb786bd)

commit_message:
Dragonflow: increase timeout for fullstack jobs

[1] added some extra time to devstack setup in Dragonflow's tests due to
compilation of openvswitch, causing our jobs to time out occasionally.
Adding extra 15 minutes of grace.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/465524

Change-Id: I864936a74987bdd544fa48bbf38e231d91eb2b64

subject: Remove UUID token from Patrole jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-11 18:52:56.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/patrole.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove UUID token from Patrole jobs

According to discussion in the mailing list [0] using UUID tokens
is currently resulting in errant Keystone-related bugs. Further,
UUID tokens are currently deprecated and will be removed during
R release [0]. So we should use Fernet tokens instead.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-August/121067.html

Change-Id: I34d324575c8117022724a944c034f089eb0c7541
Related-Bug: #1710237
'}]
commit_message:
Remove UUID token from Patrole jobs

According to discussion in the mailing list [0] using UUID tokens
is currently resulting in errant Keystone-related bugs. Further,
UUID tokens are currently deprecated and will be removed during
R release [0]. So we should use Fernet tokens instead.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-August/121067.html

Change-Id: I34d324575c8117022724a944c034f089eb0c7541
Related-Bug: #1710237

subject: Skip long-running jobs for only placement-api-ref changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 21:12:22.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Skip long-running jobs for only placement-api-ref changes

We skip long-running dsvm jobs for nova changes that are
only in the api-ref tree, and we should do the same for
the placement-api-ref tree, like in this change:

Id89d7c16ca53938e2bc18e904e8d13477ceb15f7

Change-Id: Ife1e1ad0fa2dd54f5f92d72e044e11b6987ba15e
'}]

subject: Disable track_instance_changes when in superconductor mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-01 20:40:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Disable track_instance_changes when in superconductor mode

When configured for superconductor mode, which is the default,
nova-compute can't reach the MQ for nova-scheduler so there is
no point in even enabling the track_instance_changes code since
it's a waste of time as the scheduler will never get the message.

Change-Id: I2662ebd47323428b403d3c2236bec78f1fb1050f
"}]
commit_message:
Disable track_instance_changes when in superconductor mode

When configured for superconductor mode, which is the default,
nova-compute can't reach the MQ for nova-scheduler so there is
no point in even enabling the track_instance_changes code since
it's a waste of time as the scheduler will never get the message.

Change-Id: I2662ebd47323428b403d3c2236bec78f1fb1050f

commit_message:
bdist build failed due to wrong data_file references

In data_file section in setup.cfg,
data_files =
    /etc/masakarimonitors = etc/masakarimonitors/hostmonitor.conf
    /etc/masakarimonitors = etc/masakarimonitors/processmonitor.conf
    /etc/masakarimonitors = etc/masakarimonitors/proc.list
This should change to,
data_files =
    /etc/masakarimonitors = etc/masakarimonitors/hostmonitor.conf.sample
    /etc/masakarimonitors = etc/masakarimonitors/processmonitor.conf.sample
    /etc/masakarimonitors = etc/masakarimonitors/proc.list.sample

Change-Id: I341bd4e93656b6ac621e35f52ad8da382fe19c9c
Closes-Bug: #1702849

commit_message:
Implements alarm counts API

This change is to introduce a new rest api (v1/alarm/count) to
vitrage to provide counts of any alarms present in the system.
- It can optionally provide counts of alarms for all_tenants
  similarly to the alarm api
- The rest api doc has been updated
- Unit test were added to test the api with and without
  all_tenants as well as noauth

Change-Id: I6061b63c068580dcd25df5c624d9b3bd88f30cca
Implements: blueprint alarm-counts-api
Signed-off-by: Tyler Smith <tyler.smith@windriver.com>

subject: Fix gate mtu tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-13 18:09:31.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix gate mtu tests

This new commit [1] in neutron checks mtu size during segment
allocation and throws exception if MTU > 1450 for geneve network
type. Because of this new change, tests
'test_clear_segment_host_mapping' and
'test_update_segment_host_mapping' are failing in gate.

To fix this, we are updating mtu to 1450 in the test, before it
creates geneve segments for the network.

[1] ceb86366d25a928d7a3773075a7333801ee3dd29

Closes-bug: #1710496
Change-Id: I117cc2352848718b37f95bdb6aecbfb6ba1ccc67
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gate mtu tests

This new commit [1] in neutron checks mtu size during segment
allocation and throws exception if MTU > 1450 for geneve network
type. Because of this new change, tests
'test_clear_segment_host_mapping' and
'test_update_segment_host_mapping' are failing in gate.

To fix this, we are updating mtu to 1450 in the test, before it
creates geneve segments for the network.

[1] ceb86366d25a928d7a3773075a7333801ee3dd29

Closes-bug: #1710496
Change-Id: I117cc2352848718b37f95bdb6aecbfb6ba1ccc67

subject: [db] Optimize a db migration
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-07 11:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['rally/common/db/sqlalchemy/migrations/versions/c517b0011857_fill_missed_workload_info.py'], 'message': "[db] Optimize a db migration

It was a bad idea to grep all workload data for all workloads, subtasks
and tasks in a memory. For big database it can eat all the memory.
Let's load workload data per workload. It will make more calls to
database, but should not affect the memory.

Change-Id: Id4e408dd5491d9e0c6f59ff0cf7a81745bf9564e
"}]
commit_message:
[db] Optimize a db migration

It was a bad idea to grep all workload data for all workloads, subtasks
and tasks in a memory. For big database it can eat all the memory.
Let's load workload data per workload. It will make more calls to
database, but should not affect the memory.

Change-Id: Id4e408dd5491d9e0c6f59ff0cf7a81745bf9564e

subject: Make provision to evacuate all instances
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1011, 'name': 'Tushar Patil', 'email': 'tushar.vitthal.patil@gmail.com', 'username': 'tpatil'}, {'_account_id': 8716, 'name': 'Sampath Priyankara', 'email': 'sam47priya@gmail.com', 'username': 'sampath'}, {'_account_id': 8988, 'name': 'Rikimaru Honjo', 'email': 'honjo.rikimaru@ntt-tx.co.jp', 'username': 'rikimaru.honjo', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 25267, 'name': 'NTT system-fault-ci masakari-integration-ci', 'email': 'masakari.integration.test@gmail.com', 'username': 'masakari-integration-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-09 10:32:11.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/host_failure.py', 'masakari/tests/unit/fakes.py', 'masakari/tests/unit/engine/drivers/taskflow/test_host_failure_flow.py'], 'message': "Make provision to evacuate all instances

As of now host failure workflow was evacuating instances which were
having vm_state as active, stopped, error and resize. It was ignoring
other vm_states such as shelved, rescued, paused and suspended. Made
provision to evacuate instances which are having vm_states such as
shelved, rescued, paused and suspended by changing its vm_state to
error and after evacuating those instances will be stopped.

NOTE:
On master if the instance is in error or resized state then after
recovery it was becoming active. With this patch error instances
will be stopped and then set to error after recovery. For resized
instance if it's previous power_state is 4(SHUTDOWN) then we can
say that before failure the instance was is stopped state and then
it was resized so masakari will stop that instance to maintain
consistency of instance states as the instance was not fully
resized(resize operation was not confirmed). Resized instance which
was in active state before failure will become active again after
recovery.

Closes-Bug: #1693731
Closes-Bug: #1692435
Closes-Bug: #1690995
Closes-Bug: #1690768
Change-Id: I134e8b6ee7315935bd8ce418ef6241be0b9450b3
"}]
commit_message:
Make provision to evacuate all instances

As of now host failure workflow was evacuating instances which were
having vm_state as active, stopped, error and resize. It was ignoring
other vm_states such as shelved, rescued, paused and suspended. Made
provision to evacuate instances which are having vm_states such as
shelved, rescued, paused and suspended by changing its vm_state to
error and after evacuating those instances will be stopped.

NOTE:
On master if the instance is in error or resized state then after
recovery it was becoming active. With this patch error instances
will be stopped and then set to error after recovery. For resized
instance if it's previous power_state is 4(SHUTDOWN) then we can
say that before failure the instance was is stopped state and then
it was resized so masakari will stop that instance to maintain
consistency of instance states as the instance was not fully
resized(resize operation was not confirmed). Resized instance which
was in active state before failure will become active again after
recovery.

Closes-Bug: #1693731
Closes-Bug: #1692435
Closes-Bug: #1690995
Closes-Bug: #1690768
Change-Id: I134e8b6ee7315935bd8ce418ef6241be0b9450b3

commit_message:
Make code compatible with Python3.5

Add adjustments:
   - read configuration file in binary mode
   - remove extra encoding
   - check if string is binary class and convert it to
     standard string

Change-Id: I5f73b6b0e8b5592539e07fe66debf917540ce24c

commit_message:
Fix required python-masakariclient version

python-masakariclient version of pypi wasn't "x.x.x", that was
"2.0.1.dev5" until now.
So required version was written as ">=2.0.1.dev5" in requirements.txt
as a workaround.

But python-masakariclient version in pypi was fixed as "x.x.x".
So this patch fixes required version.

Depends-On: I4cae7cec062e92ab23890e0ef6a7f8641942c374
Change-Id: I1e373dac88994f1ec337d6c1ac6cdfe38bfbe563

commit_message:
Use prepare command to build container images env file

This change replaces the manually maintained
docker-centos-tripleoupstream.yaml with an equivalent file generated
by running "openstack overcloud container image prepare". Note that
the file containers-default-parameters.yaml is already generated with
this command thanks to I6a5796428c224584359b2a434d7fc80878d5f038.

subject: [NEWTON-ONLY] Ignore Ceph healt warning states by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-08 16:16:17.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_mon.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': "[NEWTON-ONLY] Ignore Ceph healt warning states by default

The Ceph cluster health state can change from _OK to _WARN during upgrade
because MONs are upgraded one by one and the cluster tunables can't
satisfy both instances at the same time.

This submission changes the default value of IgnoreCephUpgradeWarnings
into true, which make the upgrade script to ignore non _ERR states, while
still checking for the node to be back into quorum, behaving similarily to
ceph-ansible.

Closes-Bug: #1709370
Change-Id: I96140e32d9436aaa85003037bcc789384378b364
"}]
commit_message:
[NEWTON-ONLY] Ignore Ceph healt warning states by default

The Ceph cluster health state can change from _OK to _WARN during upgrade
because MONs are upgraded one by one and the cluster tunables can't
satisfy both instances at the same time.

This submission changes the default value of IgnoreCephUpgradeWarnings
into true, which make the upgrade script to ignore non _ERR states, while
still checking for the node to be back into quorum, behaving similarily to
ceph-ansible.

Closes-Bug: #1709370
Change-Id: I96140e32d9436aaa85003037bcc789384378b364

subject: Fix failing gate jobs by fixing constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 15:03:15.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Fix failing gate jobs by fixing constraints support

Recently we added python-masakariclient to global-requirements [1]
as a requirement library for masakari-monitors. python-masakariclient
itself is a library and adding upper constraints support to libraries
is slightly more complex than services as the libraries themselves are
listed in upper-constraints.txt which leads to errors that you can't
install a specific version and a constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-masakariclient.

This patch is a copy of commit: 78f113780510b741bc974c69eb9b0718cd657c1d

For failing jobs please refer: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492989/

[1] 1cd2c8da1a6534c23959cd0a4035e7f530471386

Change-Id: I9376ee14ebfb9186c1480276b47939c3ffc30108
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failing gate jobs by fixing constraints support

Recently we added python-masakariclient to global-requirements [1]
as a requirement library for masakari-monitors. python-masakariclient
itself is a library and adding upper constraints support to libraries
is slightly more complex than services as the libraries themselves are
listed in upper-constraints.txt which leads to errors that you can't
install a specific version and a constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-masakariclient.

This patch is a copy of commit: 78f113780510b741bc974c69eb9b0718cd657c1d

For failing jobs please refer: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492989/

[1] 1cd2c8da1a6534c23959cd0a4035e7f530471386

Change-Id: I9376ee14ebfb9186c1480276b47939c3ffc30108

Change If1eb4046865f43b15ba97c52e2d0b9343dc72c19 fixed bugs 1666493 and 1655567
that reported exception IpAddressAlreadyAllocated being raised during the
creation of IPv6 auto-address subnets. This patchset removes code that was

commit_message:
Remove code to debug auto address allocation error

Change If1eb4046865f43b15ba97c52e2d0b9343dc72c19 fixed bugs 1666493 and 1655567
that reported exception IpAddressAlreadyAllocated being raised during the
creation of IPv6 auto-address subnets. This patchset removes code that was
added by change I22b8f1f537f905f4b82ce9e50d6fcc5bf2210f9f to root-cause these
bugs.

By removing log statements, this patchset contributes to reduce the
'Neutron log obesity epidemic'

Change-Id: I28c58dc4a957df833d277f0d08ce831c7ee07c68
Partial-Bug: #1707307

commit_message:
Fix the duplicate hacking check M312 and H203

The hacking "[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None" is already enabled
in tox. But the local hacking M312 is also avaliable, there is no need to check
twice here for the same check.

Closes-Bug: #1710426
